description:
This place rocks! 

Despite an unusual combo between brunch and Mediterranean food (with a hint of southern), they pull it off swimmingly. 

The space is simple and not pretentious with a focus on service with a smile and quality cooking.

My wife and I had, what is arguably the best hummus and pita of our lives (which we would not have ordered - but the owner recommended it), scrumptious spiced friend chicken which fluffy waffles, and shakshuka (eggs cooked in a tomato sauce) which blew us away with it's flavor and texture. 

I'd totally keep this spot as our secret, but it is just too good not to share. 

Only downside is that it looks like others have discovered it and there seems to now be a waitlist.
author: Christopher w.

description:
I didn't realize how close this part of Potrero Hill was close to Mission Bay so I'm definitely glad I came out to check it out. I wasn't suuuuper wowed by my food here - ordered the shakshuka even though their speciality is definitely the chicken and waffles. The shakshuka was tasty but definitely not the best I've had. It wasn't as stew-y as I would have liked and could definitely use some extra herbs and spices. I actually enjoyed the pita & hummus more so because like previous people have said, there seems to be lot of labor and love put into perfecting their hummus. There's so much flavor and the texture is just the right about of creaminess and smoothness. If I wasn't so full after eating so much pita, I would have eaten the hummus by the spoonful.. gotta better prioritize next time haha

My friend ordered the nasi goreng topped with fried chicken; she said that while she personally enjoyed the chicken and it lives up to its reputation, the rice was a little lacking in flavor. Next time, I think I'd definitely order one of their dishes with their chicken in it. 

Service was pretty good. It definitely wasn't super busy on Friday afternoon so there was a lot of time for the employees to make their rounds and check in on us and making sure we were stocked up on pita (always appreciated!). We lucked on parking so definitely be prepared to circle around the block as it is a busy neighborhood to find a space.
author: Samantha C.

description:
While exploring the area after Hubby's appointment, we stopped here to try the fried chicken, at least Hubby did. Fried chicken is one of his favorites. He liked it with the fried rice. I thought the chicken was decent but not the best I've ever tasted. I had turkey bacon with a horrible tasting biscuit which was dry and weird. As if it was dipped in stale oil. My breakfast wasn't memorable.  

There wasn't a lot of customers in the place so it was quiet. A single unisex bathroom right in front of us .  I heard the owner telling one of the female cooks about stirring something while she was cooking.  We wondered if she was in training. Food was OK but probably wouldn't make a return visit.
author: Ry T.

description:
I was extremely disappointed in this place. After reading such positive reviews and seeing pictures of the food, it looked like a solid choice for brunch on this beautiful Sunday. 

THE WAIT: After joining the wait list on yelp and waiting for about an hour before we were seated, and when we were finally seated we found out we had to order at the counter. It took another 40 mins to get our food after ordering. 

FOOD: My party of 4 had the chicken and waffles, the chicken sandwich, Indonesian fried rice, and matcha French toast. I was shocked with the chicken and the French toast -- not in a good way. Though the chicken was cooked well and was nice and crispy, it hardly had any flavor. I'm not sure how they prepare the chicken but I really think it would benefit from a brine... whether it be buttermilk or otherwise and addition flavor on the reading. It wasn't salty enough and again, lacked flavor. With so many places in sf and in the greater Bay Area that serve chicken and waffles, I feel like they really missed the mark and missed an opportunity here. The waffle was okay, pretty dense-- if that's what you like, but nothing special. The syrup was standard as well. 

The match French toast, I was really excited about, was poorly executed. It was soggy, also lacked flavor-- I couldn't taste any matcha. I feel like it would have benefited from sprinkling a matcha/powdered sugar on top or even doing a matcha whipped cream -- very easy things that would definitely elevate the dish. Also I believe choosing a thicker bread that holds would have been better. Again, it was really soggy... and then on top of that putting a runny whipped cream and macerated fruit (which included grapes... which I think is a weird choice since grapes are expensive and typically aren't good warm) made it even worse. The whipped cream looked and tasted like it was from the can... Also I think the fruit had some kind of herb? That definitely did not go with matcha.... though matcha French toast is unique, there are so many ways to execute it and get even more creative and this definitely was not it. It's obvious that it wasn't well thought out. 

The chicken sandwich was also disappointing. The bun was average, but it looked flattened (probably when cooked) and the slaw was okay, but there was no sauce!!! Which was really strange to me... it's the same chicken as the chicken and waffles I believe and it again lacked flavor... they should include an aioli or something... again, I was disappointed and feel like not enough thought was put into this dish and the opportunity to elevate it wasn't taken advantage of. 

SERVICE: service was fine, nothing special. 

ENVIRONMENT: it was a pretty small space and got pretty loud in there. Definitely felt crammed... but it didn't bother me. 

SUMMARY: overall there's a lot of areas of improvement... I was disappointed. There's so many cute places in the area... I'd go there instead.
author: Kaitlyn E.

description:
4.5 stars really - they are getting downgraded for a simple and stupid reason maybe they can learn from.

We were there fairly early on a Sat. No line, the place had maybe 4 tables occupied maybe 7 as we left.

The food was DELICIOUS. we spilt the chicken/waffles and got a side of lemon ricotta pancakes. I am a new Englander so I always come prepared and BYOPMS (Bring My Own Pure Maple Syrup). But not necessary - not only do they serve it - they give you a BIG portion (unlike Plow sometimes).

Here is the .5 star off reason.  I had a big brunch and wanted to use the bathroom, there was a guy taking his sweet time mopping the floor - with the bathroom door wide open to the restaurant. I swear he was doing it for over 20 mins. I finally left without getting to use it - but the table next to me also wanted to use it. Can't you get that done prior to open, or maybe at closing time the day before?
author: Amy W.

description: Impressed by the food AND wonderful service.  I love shakshuka & really enjoyed theirs.  Their hummus is a 3 day labor of love that you shouldn't miss out on. I added a side of fried chicken bc, why not & happy I did.  Already know what I want next time I go   excited to come back!
author: Jenny G.

description:
We went for brunch and loved it. A fairly new business so I won't ding stars just yet, but they do need to work on a few things...but first let me tell you the good.

We ordered the chicken and waffles - YUM, lemon ricotta pancakes - YUM, and the Nasi Goreng - YUM. The chicken was crispy on the outside with delicious spices and tender inside and boneless which I personally love. The pancake was nice and thick and you can taste the flavors which is always a plus. The Nasi Goreng has more crispy chicken but with an interesting rice to accompany it, super flavorful. Water was served right away as well as coffee.

Things to work on - Waitlist, once this gets bad you probably shouldn't seat tables that don't have everyone in the party present yet. Refills on coffee, maybe more staff could help with this. Finally, I couldn't get over the order at the cashier and take a number and go back to your table protocol. This restaurant just doesn't feel like it should be run like that so maybe more staff will help with this as well. 

Overall, worth it and we'll be back!
author: Guisela L.

description:
Food: 4.5 stars
Service: 2 stars

This place was just up the road from our Airbnb and was a far shorter line than Plow just a couple blocks away

You can check in via Yelp in advance which is a plus!

The service here is a little awkward (or a lot!). Once it is your turn to be sat, you get a table. After that your on your own......

We ended up getting our own menus and asking for water. We also had to infer from everyone else that you had to go up and order and pay for you food. A little bit of signage here would go a long way. Hard to tip when you do all the work. 

The food however was a different story. My wife got the sampler with pancakes, eggs, and sausage. I got the chicken and waffles. Both meals were delicious and the chicken and waffles was crispy and VERY tasty!

I'd come back here for the food itself, but the service needs some changing.
author: Richard F.

description:
Stumbled upon this exciting brunch restaurant by accident and had to come here the next day. Arrived at a full site with happy customers. Husband and I knew immediately what we wanted since we were drooling over the menu yesterday. I got the shakshouka and he got the soujouk scramble.

The owners and staff are quite welcoming. We also received a complimentary hummus platter which was not only aesthetically pleasing with the essential hummus, oil, olives and a hot sauce but the taste was so addicting! As husband had put it, the hummus was not boring as most places make it but quite flavorful. I even ate the black and green olives and loved it! There were a few pita triangles that accompanied it-perhaps a few more would even out the delish hummus.

Ahh, the shakshouka! Cutely plated on its own porcelain skillet-with eggs, herbs and a few pita triangles. The only minus to this for me personally was that it was more soupy requiring a spoon rather than a stew or sauce with a fork. The taste otherwise was delicious! Quite hearty, flavorful and nicely textured chunkiness of tomatoes and onions. Just a tad too bit liquid-y for my fork.

I also tasted the husband's soujouk scramble which was with scallions, tasty potatoes and pita triangles. It was a good mixture of sausage and egg proportion.

I also had the fortune to have their iced green matcha tea which was really refreshing and something I would definitely try again.

The waffles and syrup looked and smelt so good!! We were teased by the waiter with it when he was looking for the customer who ordered it. The fried chicken looks really good as well. The person next to me had a Benedict with the fried chicken and said it was good but surprisingly spicy for her. I would probably try the Nasi goreng, fried chicken or waffles next time.

Definitely looking forward to coming here again. Really enjoyed the ambiance and space. In a nice trendy area with other interesting restaurants. As I look around, the restaurant keeps filling up with no empty seat! 

Thank you, Cracked and Battered for entering the SF restaurant scene and for giving us awesome diverse dishes to happily consume! Tasty and friendly-yes, please.
author: Summer S.

description:
Pretty good in quality, quantity, and the value. I ordered Nasi Goreng, the chicken is really juicy and tender inside, crispy outside, and the poached eggs are right on! Highly recommend.

I saw a lot people ordered the waffle chicken, the most expensive on the menu, the portion came really large, I think it could be shared by 2ppl. Would be too much for 1 person, especially girls.

They also served a hummus as complimentary because it took a while for them to serve the food, thumbs up!
author: Christine Z.

description:
Waiting system definitely needs work. The food I got was better than Sally's but not as good as Plow. Probably won't be back anytime soon.

.....
Service:
Boyfriend and I stood in line to order and when we were two customers away from the cashier, the waitress comes up to us to write our names down, saying we must wait outside and that she'll call our names. That was not the case for the people before us. Some of the people behind us grabbed a table before ordering but she didn't seem to notice them. 

We waited attentively two feet from the entrance, expecting a short wait as we were first or second on the list. A few minutes later she called a name for a table of two--the couple she called actually stood behind us but we let it go. Then another two parties were welcomed in, and I see her crossing out names below ours. We confronted her and she was like 'oh yea I called your name...' (Not at all apologetic).

Maybe she did call our names inside the restaurant but she definitely did NOT come outside to call our names. Clearly she didn't know what she was doing and was inconsistent with implementing her waiting system.

Good to know she let a total of 7 people "cut" in front of us which resulted in us not being able to order the nitro matcha that ran out right before we ordered. Not a huge deal but it added to our already unpleasant experience. 

We sat next to the couple who was after us and watched them finish their meals before we even got ours. 
........
Else:

The menu was pretty unique, and the place has more seating than Plow. Pricey for a place that is pay up front. 

I would not recommend the lemon ricotta pancakes if you are looking for something fluffy, lemony, and ricotta-y. These pancakes were normal pancakes; the first three bites had a slight lemon aftertaste and the ricotta was very subtle if anything. The butter and syrup might have overpowered the flavors even more. 

Weightlifters Delight was ok. The egg white scramble was juicy which threw off the texture for me though I still enjoyed it. Lots of pepper and sausage chunks. Potatoes were pretty tasty with some fried onion bits thrown over it. Unsure what the four flimsy pita was for as there was no dip, no sauce, no hummus, and no flavor. 

Nasi Goreng, or the cabbage fried rice with chicken was my favorite. It was also substantial. Pretty good flavors though it could have used more cabbage. The fried chicken was dry but well seasoned.
author: Lydia Z.

description:
There's a new brunch spot on Potrero Hill, and amazingly, I've patronized it already like I was a hot-to-Yelp tastemaker or something. I'm usually around the 743rd person to review a newish place because I just hate dealing with crowds, but this wasn't the case here as I happened to be traipsing in the 'hood and found this spot relatively empty on a weekday afternoon. It's on the corner of 18th and Connecticut where the usually bustling Aperto was. I had no idea Aperto shuttered its doors, but hell, I'm off pasta anyway.

They have quite an international array of menu items like the $14.50 Nasi Goreng, an Indonesian cabbage fried rice, and the $13 Moroccan favorite, Shakshouka. But the top line dish was obviously the $16 Chicken and Waffles which I saw on a couple of tables. Alas, I decided to focus on the Light Plated Stuff listed in the menu. I went with the $12 Fattoush Salad, a plate which mixed fresh elements such as kale, romaine, parsley, mint leaves, sumac, onion, tomatoes, olives, and cucumbers with toasted pita chips.

The problem with had with the dish was that it was absolutely drenched in a puckery oil-lemon vinaigrette (photo: http://bit.ly/2v25Xmo). The flavor ended up overwhelming the salad, and I should have gone with my gut and ordered the dressing on the side. Just because I wanted something sweet as a contrast, I ordered the $4 Seasonal Fruit, which was a plate of just fresh blueberries infused with lemon rose water (photo: http://bit.ly/2v3CAAh). Simple but it worked. The service was certainly sincere, and I think I'll give them another try when I feel more calorically confident.

FOOD - 3 stars...nice try on the salad but ease off on the vinaigrette
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...less packed than it was as Aperto with rustic touches providing a hipster edge
SERVICE - 4 stars...affable and attentive 
TOTAL - 3 stars...global brunch concept is appealing, I expect more menu choices after their soft opening phase

RELATED - Collection of breakfast and brunch places I've tried and reviewed: http://bit.ly/2At2LFz
author: Ed U.

description:
Came here for the soft opening.

I love coming to restaurants during a soft opening because typically they're experimenting and trying to figure out what's going to stick to the menu or not before they commit. Cracked & Battered definitely has solid competition with Mochica, Mac Daddy, Chez Maman, and Parkers all within a block. 

I ordered chicken & waffles with an iced matcha. The matcha has no added sugar in it, which I love, but if you realize you don't actually like matcha then you better sweeten that sucker up or order something else.

It was near close and the chef sent over a house hummus- which was really delicious (and satisfied my craving because I was originally considering going Mediterranean for brunch). I am intrigued as to how the Middle Eastern cuisine is going to blend with what seems like a very typically American breakfast menu.

Chicken & Waffle - the chicken was super juicy, definitely used dark meat (smart choice). The waffle is on the fluffier side, which I typically like a thinner waffle personally (but like I said, soft opening, got to play around with it). But the chicken was phenomenal and that's normally the part most restaurants don't get done right - so well done.

Extremely friendly & accommodating staff! 

Excited to see how they finalize this menu & what sticks.
author: Arezou A.

description: Drawn here by the nasi goreng and it was delicious. Fried chicken was very juicy, and seasoned well. The lemon ricotta pancakes were another favorite of ours. Super fluffy and I liked how they had a hint of salt to balance the sweetness and lift the flavor. They serve kombucha and a nice iced matcha green tea on tap. Great service too.
author: Weich Y.

description:
Walked over for brunch today and ordered the chicken and waffles. The suggested auto-tip is a bit high for a place where you order at the counter and grab your own utensils.

The fried chicken is made to order and came out perfect. The waffles came out cold though and the refrigerated butter had a hard time melting because of room temperature waffles. If they serve hot waffles, this would be a fantastic dish.

Would come back.
author: Brian T.

description:
I JUST saw Ant Man & Wasp last night then finally went here right now for brunch. The house Ant Man lives in in the movie? It's literally on this same block. Literally.

I had no idea. When I noticed I was like wtf!

NASI GORENG $15
Tenderaz thigh like KFC Extra Tasty Crispy but boneless = even better.
Spicy ricy.

GRILLED BRIE $13
For sweet tooth x drunchies.
Me & all the suburban milfs brie-ing on the weekends. #stephencolbert

MUSIC mix of club hiphop & motown & Latin...

Zesty flavors, loud convos, I like this place.
author: Dan B.

description:
This place is fairly new so the customer service is still in proper training. It's located at the corner of the street. It has limited seating -- 35-40 seats available. Water and utensils are self serve. 

I ordered the nasi goreng that came with two fried eggs, a battered fried chicken breast, and stir fried rice with cabbage bits. The nasi goreng has an overwhelming sweet taste with a spicy aftertaste. You don't really taste anything spicy but it leaves that heat in the end. I didn't get to finish it because of the overwhelming sweet taste of the fried rice but the chicken was delicious! Very tender and juicy. 

I think I'm going to try their other brunch items because it looked pretty good as I walked past by other tables and saw their meal. Maybe I'll get their chicken and waffles! In the mean time, I would definitely pass on the nasi goreng.
author: Sarah F.

description:
Came here with the sole purpose of trying the waffle. Based on past reviews it seemed like a sure thing, I'd walk away with the perfect start to my morning. 

Unfortunately, it was the softest waffle I've tasted. Not undercooked, but they use a batter with little to no air, no flakiness. It's heavy and cake-like. Underwhelming to say the least. Flavor was fine, but I was quite disappointed by the execution.
author: Jackie T.

description:
Great to see a new place open up on 18th! We happened to see the soft opening sign and came in to take a look.

Really interesting menu that has mix of shakshuka, soujouk, nasi goreng and chicken and waffles.  Wasn't sure what to get, and was wondering if they could pull off having such diversity of cuisines

Ordered the nasi goreng which was, as advertised in its description, "hearty".  The chicken was very nicely battered and juicy.  At first glance it didn't look like a large portion but turned out there is a whole well of food in what looks at first glance as a plate.  Very tasty, and proved they could make the different world cuisine elements work.

Also ordered the grilled brie.   Gotta love the sweetness of the fig jam with the melty cheese and crunch of the toasted bread

The folks there were super nice and welcoming.  Hoping to come back and try some more of their stuff!
author: Marshall Y.

description:
I always get excited when I hear about a new brunch spot in the Portrero neighborhood! The organization just wasn't there and the food was ok...

Why I was here // Came on a weekend around 1pm for a late later brunch since I had a pretty late start to my morning. 

Atmosphere & Service // rustic and wooden farm to table kind of look. Your order and pay at the register, then you get a number and they bring the food to you. You have to get your own water/utensils/napkins/etc...which is hidden in the back. Food took a really long time to come out.....I think they lost our ticket because pretty much people who had come after us received their food before we did. To make amends they did offer us a mini hummus plate and unfortunately I like the hummus better than any other the entrees we got. 

Food // 

-green tea nitro on tap - refreshing and clean taste, not sweet at all but very yummy

-fried chicken egg benedict // The chicken was fried up nicely, but the hollandaise sauce was just not a winner for me. It was extremely lemony and when I ate it, I just wasn't left feeling satisfied. The biscuit that it came on was overly rich - very oily and made me feel a bit meh after eating a few bites. They ran out of home potatoes so I was left with salad, which I am actually very happy I had. 

-chicken and waffles // my bf got this one and although we loved how juicy the chicken was, he said the waffle was kind of dry....

Overall // 
I want to give this place another shot, they have shashouka which I feel like is a winner, but we will see. At 18.00 per entree its a bit steep, especially since the last food experience was just ok.
author: Emily T.

description:
Great place!! Delicious food, hot coffee, fresh juice. My kids like it. Specially the waffles. I like the hummus with olive oil. 
Thanks.
author: Shady S.

description:
3.5 stars.
Came here around 1:30 PM on a Sunday (30 mins prior to closing), but they didn't make any deal of it, and there was no wait.

The servers are all very friendly and seem to enjoy working there.

Order at the counter and then place your number on the table.
We ordered two chicken and waffles and the manager brought hummus and pita for us to try.

Typically we order different dishes so we can try more items and share, so I think it speaks to their menu offerings that we ended up ordering the same thing.

Their hummus was extremely good! I'm generally a hummus lover, but their (plain) hummus was delicious. We had way more hummus than we had pita for, and we asked them for more pita, but they forgot to bring it, which is no biggie since it was free, but it would have been nice!
The chicken was very dark fried and could have been crispier, but the flavoring was good. The waffle was nice and crispy on the outside. 
One plate was definitely enough for two meals for both of us and we're pretty big eaters.

Overall, it wasn't anything too memorable, and I'd opt to try one of the other brunch places in SF before returning.
author: Connie T.

description:
Meh. Long line, about 45-minutes, for mediocre food and service. This place is disorganized and can't handle the number of tables offered (only about 12 or so). Multiple staff walking around doing close to nothing but chatting with their friends. Once my "cakey" waffle arrived I asked for syrup, could see that it was super dry as it was, server says yes and then turns to hang out with a friend that was visiting - no syrup. 

The worse part, you pay first. So you tip prior to assessing quality of the food or service. 

Won't go back.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Went over there for breakfast because it's new in the neighborhood. Was a little bit disappointed to begin with, due to the fact that the restaurant uses a cost-cutting tactic common in San Francisco: ordering at the counter. Prices don't reflect this lower of quality of the service.

Not a huge deal, I can live with it. The problem is that my chicken & waffles were terrible. The Belgian waffle tasted like it might have been frozen and the chicken was dry and apparently seasoned with nothing but salt. Due to the cost-cutting system of service at this restaurant, I was chosen to get a water refill only once.

All around terrible, but I really wish it weren't.
author: Robert M.

description:
Heard there was a new chicken and waffles place in town, thought it'd be a great way to enjoy a Saturday morning. And boy, were we satisfied! My friends and I came at 10:30am so service was on top of it. The waitresses were so kind and enthusiastic; they definitely brought the sunny side up! 

I ordered the Nasi Goreng. It was an interesting mix of flavors with the cabbage complimenting the slightly spicy fried rice and egg yolk melting onto the fried chicken. I recommend adding a little more salt and pepper to the fried chicken just to add more flavor. But ultimately, you'll leave with a filled belly.
author: Michael D.

description:
In the former Aperto spot now resides Cracked & Battered. We arrived at the end of their Sunday brunch hours, ordered at the counter, grabbed our own utensils & sat down at one of the few unoccupied tables. 

We couldn't resist a couple rare brunch finds on C&B's menu, namely Nasi Goreng, Indonesian fried rice, (my dining partner & I had both been to Bali separately & exchanged island memories over this dish), & their grilled brie & fig jam sandwich with a side of fattoush salad. The fried rice was spicy & came with two fried eggs & a piece of fried chicken (I don't eat dark meat chicken but I picked at the batter which was well seasoned, but not too crisp.) The sandwich looked like something I could make at home & the salad was a bit overdressed. 

Overall, it was a mediocre meal that made us long for our usual Potrero Hill eateries. C&B also serves Chicken & Waffles and Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, menu items that their competitors have perfected; unless C&B's version blows those out of the water, they're better off focusing their menu around the Indonesian & Middle Eastern dishes that can successfully set them apart. P. Hill has their quota of great brunch spot, but I haven't seen Nasi Goreng on too many menus...
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Wow! This place lived up to the hype!  If you're a fan of fried chicken, you need to come here!  Great food and friendly service in a casual, attractive setting.

My husband and I shared the following two dishes:

1) Fried Chicken and waffles - excellent, moist chicken with a wonderfully seasoned batter; the waffle was fluffy and flavorful.  This was a truly great dish.

2) Nasi Goreng - very tasty, with delicious, well spiced fried chicken.  This was a little bit too spicy for me, but my husband didn't find it too spicy at all.

The service was fast and friendly (you order at the counter, and they then bring your food out to you).  They helped us find a spot for our baby in her stroller, which we appreciated.

The space is a decent size, and I liked the rustic decor.

Overall, a great place for fried chicken!
author: Barnali D.

description:
Came here on a weekend for brunch. There was no line when arriving and the workers said it was self seating and you order up at the counter and they deliver to your table when it is ready.

I ordered their chicken and waffles. It came with half of a waffle and two pieces of chicken.  The chicken was decently seasoned but the waffle itself was pretty bland(even with the syrup).

They did not have ice available to have ice coffee at the time, but maybe they have it now.  It seemed they they also got an alcohol license since there are taps behind the counter.

The utensils are also self service as well as the water, which they use Mason jars as glasses. It is in the corner of the place which can be cumbersome to get to if you are on the opposite side of the restaurant and there are other people blocking your way. 

Overall, it was an alright experience. The food was okay, but not spectacular. It can be an option to check out if you don't want to wait that hour for Plow or other brunch places a few blocks away
author: Jacky C.

description:
After coming to the soft opening I would definitely say that they need some work... I don't want to be that "person" after all the great reviews and I understand that they're still new after all...

First off, the wait was not too bad in the beginning. My fiance and I walked in on a Sunday afternoon at around 1pm and the wait was 15 minutes, give or take. We were seated and given the menus and had to go up to order and pay. I wanted lemon ricotta pancakes but also wanted chicken. The lady was nice enough to accommodate my wishes by making my dish like a chicken and waffles. My fiance got the regular chicken and waffles ($16). I was starving and borderline "hangry". The wait for food was around 20 minutes and I kept in mind that this was a soft opening so I tried not to get too agitated if the wait was a bit long but... When I got my food I was pretty disappointed.

My chicken had great texture, it was crispy and soft inside, but it had no flavor at all. I'm not sure if they forgot to season it because everything else was great (texture wise). My lemon ricotta was also pretty bland and was overtaken by the ricotta cheese over the sweetness and lemon flavor. The texture was also pretty great. Normally, when I eat food and I am super the hungry ... I would love the food. I was really disappointed in the lack of flavor considering this. 

Overall, the people were great, nice location, decent parking, but the food did not impress me.
author: Lyra C.

description:
A great start to a Saturday morning. Delicious food but no photos because for some reason my food was late. Wait list: I used the yelp waitlist feature from my house. By the time I grabbed a lyft and arrived we we seated within 2 minutes. There were about 20 people in line. I hope more places use this feature since it felt good not to have to wait. 
Environment: Inside it was surprisingly small, but quaint and cute. We sat at a counter facing the street. Everyone was busy and tables were turning over fast. We ordered at the counter and got a number for our table. It worked because waiters weren't floating around asking if we were ready to order and we didn't have to wait around for our check after the meal.  Menu: interesting twists on favorites all around. I had Cabbage Fried Rice with Fried Chicken that came with 2 eggs over easy. My friend had the Ricotta Pancakes and a side of potatoes. She ate it all but complained the potatoes were SUPER spicy. I ate half my dish and wished i could take it home because it was so good. The fried chicken was spicy too. It's the same chicken they use for the Chicken and waffles so I would try that next time. I saw some paper signs mentioning mimosas but we resisted day drinking because we were planning a day of hiking. Nice addition to the brunch scene. I will be back.
author: Marcy H.

description: You've got to check this place out, just opened a month ago and it has so much charm and warmth to it. This place will be the cornerstone of your go to place for homey breakfast and brunch place. A meal will take you through the day, it is so fresh and such friendly service too.
author: Mehran A.

description: A friend and I visited this place for the first time on Sunday morning at 11.  There is no line so that's awesome.  Parking not difficult either.  We split a Shakshuka dish and a plate of 2 lemon ricotta pancakes.  We each ordered coffee.  Have to say that the 2 lemon ricotta pancakes were delish. The Shakshuka was a little on the stingy side...  2 eggs on top with a little bit of tomatoes and pita bread.  The coffee was $4 each and thin.  Net net is the food was okay but not matching to the prices that they charge.  For $4 a cup they need to up their coffee game.
author: Kelly M.

description:
This new place, Cracked & Battered, in Portrero Hill (that was previously Chef's Corner in San Mateo) has got some of the most flavorful and different dishes for a breakfast! We've ordered 
- Shakshuka which had strong tomato flavors, 
- Crispy, non greasy, spices-infused fried chicken,
- mouth watering lemon pancakes, and 
- Nasi gorang which was the star of the afternoon! 
We are definitely coming back. 
Even the staff there are very courteous and warm. Give it a shot before it gets crazy busy!
author: Sowmya S.

description:
Nice corner brunch spot with tons of flavor. 
We ordered the midnight burger and nasi goreng, and I gotta say, the juiciness of the meat and seasoning used in the dishes were nothing short of world class. Excellent service, and real nice overall feel. Will definitely be back!
author: Oowop J.

description:
We live in the area and I was excited to see a new brunch place open up so we came here for a noon-time Saturday brunch. I joined the Yelp waitlist about 15 minutes before arriving, and got seated right away. We ordered our food at the counter and then sat down. 

Service: The food took a while to come, but the staff was very nice about it and checked in on us multiple times. To make up for the long wait time, they gave us free hummus plate on the house.

Food: The hummus was so soft and creamy - love that style. Shakshouka was very flavorful and rich. Would be nice to have a larger side of bread to be able to scoop all the tomato up. Nasi goreng was great too. The chicken was a bit spicy and kind of overpowered the rest of the dish. I recommend adding more onions to the fried rice so it doesn't only taste like cabbage. I loved how generous this restaurant is with the egg.
author: Japna S.

description:
I went on Sunday with my boyfriend and we loved it!
I ordered the Fried Chicken Eggs Benedict and I loved it. It was so good and I loved the little spice the sauce had. The potatoes were also very very good. My bf ordered the Midnight burger and it looked delicious. He didn't enjoy it as much but that was his own fault as he ate it and made a mess with the egg (lol). However, to make up for that we had also ordered a waffle w/ fruit on top and it was delicious. Overall I would definitely go back the food was great.
author: Bryanna R.

description: Say "YES" to everything on the menu. The guys and I went there for Friday lunch; everything was delicious. The fried chicken was so good, but a lot for lunch, so split it. The Vegetarian amongst us got the shakshuka. Would be nice if they had beer and were open for dinner.
author: Greta K.

description:
I came here Saturday morning for their soft opening and I was pleasantly surprised! Definitely coming back. It's a unique place that serves more than just your average white people breakfast foods, by incorporating dishes from Middle Eastern/Asian cultures along with your classic American brunch dishes like eggs benny, waffles, etc. Ok side rant but honestly people need to be more risky with trying new foods, because I sat by the window and saw so many people walk by, glance at the menu, probably saw the ~shockingly hard to pronounce~ names of ethnic dishes and keep walking. lmao ok but you just missed out on this amazing brunch place. 

It's a laid-back cafe-style brunch place where you order at the counter and seat yourself. The staff is incredibly friendly, helpful, and responsive. You can tell they care about every aspect of your experience here. They even gave us a hummus on the house.

We got the chicken & waffles (which is famous here) and the shakshouka. The shakshouka consisted of two poached eggs on a bed of sauce made of tomatoes and other veggies/herbs, and some pita slices. I normally don't get meatless dishes because I need my meat ficcs in order to feel satisfied but this dish was soooo satisfying. If you love tomatoes and eggs, you will love this dish, which is the most heavenly mixture of the two. 

The chicken & waffles were also so good and holds up to the hype. The chicken is super crispy and perfectly salted, and the portions are very large. The waffle is also not overly buttered so it feels much lighter and less fatty, which I love.
author: Brittany H.

description: Great food. I had Nasi Goreng and the chicken came out tender and juicy. Yum. I also received complimentary pita bread and hummus that was hot!!!
author: Vivy C.

description:
Check this new place out if you want a great breakfast or brunch meal! 
My wife and I ordered the Shakshouka and Soujouk Scramble respectfully. As an appetizer we had the hummus plate. 
The Shakshouka was very flavorful and hearty. Mixing the over easy egg with it made it even better!
The beef sausage in the Soujouk Scramble added the perfect balance of that savory meat flavor with the scrambled egg and the scallions and white onion added a great blend of complex flavors. 
The hummus was one of the best I ever had; it wasn't boring or plain like most; it had a great little kick and the texture was smooth with the right amount of olive oil and spices. 

The owner and staff were super friendly and happy to serve you. The atmosphere was busy but welcoming and relaxing. The decor was modern and hip; part rustic farm-like pieces accompanied by art depicting SF. 

Overall, I'm very happy with my visit and plan to come here again and  again as one of my new favorite go-to places to eat!
author: William B.

description:
Loving this new additional to Potrero Hill. Much needed. Loving the vibe of this place. It's a casual simple addition. Simple dishes. Nothing fancy, but has a real home cooked style. You order at the counter and grab a number. 

Had the Nasi Goreng. Their take was adding 2 fried eggs and a piece of fry chicken. The battered chicken was super good. The rice and eggs were what you would expect. Not the best Nasi Goreng ever, but the combination made it a satisfying experience. 

It's a tad pricey, but what isn't in San Francisco? 

If the chicken is an example of what's to come, I'm excited to try the other dishes.
author: Michael B.

description:
Very attentive staff and tasty food. I had the fried chicken egg hollandaise and it was so good. The sauce was one of the nicest I've ever had. I went there about 8.30am so I was the only one there. My baby was making lots of loud happy noises and the owner came over to chat to me about his children and how he came to set up this new restaurant 

The menu is a little unusual but I think that's good and I look forward to trying some new dishes next time
author: Ger A.

description: Great food and service. Location is ideal- you can almost always find street parking. Doesn't get too loud inside. Lots of variety on menu including chicken&waffles as well as matcha and kombucha on tap. I sat at the breakfast bar but they have a huge corner booth style seating area that's super comfy. They were mindful of my diet restrictions. Picture is the weightlifters delight with sourdough instead of a biscuit. So good!
author: Ashli A.

description:
After reading all the reviews I was a bit apprehensive but decided to give it a try. 
The waitlist curfluffle seems to have been addressed. Now there is a iPad out front to add your name and get a text when you're next. Solved. 
We waited about 15 minutes for a table. 
Staff is polite and service is good. 
Food is GREAT!  
The fried chicken was hot and spicy. The waffle was just sweet enough and freshly crisp. Syrup was perfect. 
You order at the counter and pay first, but this is their thing. Adapt. It's worth it.
author: Kim K.

description: A nice option if you only want to enjoy a quiet breakfast alone. The lemon pancake with ricotta cheese is not as good as I expected but the staff is super nice by offering a hummus as a free starter :-)
author: Jing H.

description:
Absolutely loved the gorgeous fried chicken which was soft and crunchy at the same time .
And the waffle was so airy and light ...
Must eat the Eggs Benedict also ..
I am waiting to try and explore more menu options soon ...
I just wish they Had Fresh juices for breakfast ...
author: Abhilasha S.

description: Cute venue! Quiet during the day and the servers were very attentive. The food was delicious too.
author: Emily R.

description:
Can't write this review without adding a rating unfortunately.

We added our name to the waitlist from home with a message to say we needed an outside table as we had our dogs (as pictured there are tables outside) Arrived at the place at the due time to find no tables outside. The Host advised the city didn't allow tables outside yet failed to advise prior to arrival despite this being mentioned in the reservations. Would have been nice for the heads up ;)

Will hopefully check this place out again In future without the dogs or once they are allowed tables outside as the menu looks great and will change the review based on the food quality then.
author: Steve B.

description: A family owned shop with soul put into the food. A great addition to a great neighborhood. Cheers to C&B! Excited to see their soft opening menu expand! And dinner too!
author: Waleez H.

description: Had this place bookmarked after the soft opening and walked down after the line for plow was ridiculous. So glad I did.  Lemon ricotta pancakes were so light and tasty. Any dish with fried chicken is amazing. Crispy lightly battered and the flavor was so good and chicken was moist inside.  Definitely get here before the word spreads and the line forms
author: cindy n.

description:
Super great food. Definitely recommend. 
The waffle was fluffy and the chicken was perfectly moist.
author: Amy L.

description:
I've never had to pay for my food before I've actually eaten my meal. Thought that was only a fast food thing .. like chipotle. 

Seat yourself ?! Cool .. order at the counter ?! Alright sure... pay before you sit back down ?! Um ok ...

PLOT TWIST: we were the only diners to do this. Many came before and after and didn't have this weird encounter . 

Now for the food : we both got chicken and waffles and o have to say it was pretty good. Flavorful, moist, yummy .
author: Kaitlyn S.

description: Ordered the Nasi Goreng and the Shakshouka during the soft opening phase, which is still ongoing by the way.  After grabbing our seats, we were surprised with a hummus & pita plate, which was absolutely delicious.  Both the Nasi Goreng and Shakshouka were exceptional.  The spot itself was cozy and the service was quick.  I'll definitely be back to try the rest of the menu!
author: Brian S.

description: Absolutely ADORE this spot! We came at a quiet time and sat at a window seat with a beautiful view. The service was phenomenal; every "thank you" was met with a "my pleasure". She gave us samples of the matcha and kombucha before we decided. The kombucha was amazing! Flavorful and refreshing. But the food! AMAZING! We both got the Buckwheat Pancake plate... It's $17 and you get so much food. 2 gluten free pancakes with cranberries and mangos, turkey bacon/sausage, eggs, and potatoes. The owner even brought us a side of blueberries and strawberries. The location was perfect and the experience made it even better. Will definitely be returning next time we're in the area!
author: Aspen G.

description:
Walked in to a semi busy restaurant at 11:00am. Confused from the start, there was no service, we just stood there daze and confused. We approached the front counter where there was a short line to find someone to seat us... or do we sat ourselves? Questionable. Eventually a waitress approached us and got our names down and said, "go wait outside." She could have said it in a nicer way, but that's just my opinion.
Once we were seated, the waitress told us to order and pay at the counter, strange concept for a sit down brunch. Does this mean I have to tip before I get my food?

If you plan on coming here just be prepared to stand around like a deer in a headlight. Completely understandably that they are still working things out, but maybe having menus outside and a sign up clipboard would "solve" the issue. 

+2 star for the fast food service and the taste of the food.
author: Jenny S.

description: They serve the most fluffy, magical waffles I have ever had...seriously.  The chicken is super juicy with a nice texture and flavor from the batter.  I've been here several times, and the execution is always spot-on.  The staff are welcoming and friendly, and service is solid.  I wouldn't mind seeing the menu expand a bit, but they certainly excel at what they do have!  They definitely have the best take on chicken and waffles you'll find in the Bay Area.
author: Evan M.

description: Really nice friendly wait staff. I had the lemon ricotta pancakes which I thought was delicious. Coffee kept coming and no one rushing me out even though it was a very busy Sunday morning. I'll be back.
author: Julia W.

description: It was my first time here today and it was an amazing experience! I ordered a Nasi Garong (I think that's what it's called lol) and it was just delightful. The cashier/server is sooooo nice, sweet, and accommodating. Fast and awesome service! If you haven't tried this spot, you're missing out!
author: Grace G.

description: The food taste is amazing especially Humus with virgin olive oil. The coffee was not hot enough. The staff were amazing and helpful. I recommend this place!
author: Reema M.

description: My friend and I came to this beautiful establishment on a whim looking for breakfast during lunch. I ordered the weight-lifter's delight and my friend ordered the Nasi Goreng. Their chicken is TOP 3. It tastes like it was made by a southern belle on a hot summer day. It's fried to perfection. The skin is crispy and full of flavor. It's so juicy. It's definitely worth writing home about. I'm crying chicken filled tears of joy.
author: Kie R.

description:
Stumbled upon this while looking for a breakfast place in the city. This place has a great mix of breakfast brunch and Mediterranean food. I got the chicken and waffles and a side of eggs. The waffle itself was amazing with whipped butter and warm syrup. It was fluffy but still had texture. Best part was it didn't become soggy throughout my whole meal. The fried chicken was cooked perfectly with it staying crunchy the whole time. Seasoning was definitely on point. 

It is a first come first serve basis with you ordering at the register then the food is brought to you. Prices were definitely worth what you got. Would love to come back and try other menu items. Oh and just found they will be opening for dinner too!
author: Mark A.

description:
I went with my boyfriend to check out this new place in the neighborhood -- we were really excited to see a place that serves chicken and waffles... but I guess we'll keep waiting. 

We ordered the Chicken and Waffles and the Fried Chicken Benedict, and we were underwhelmed by both. The chicken was soggy, but not as soggy as the waffles. The biscuit was overly salty, but luckily (or unluckily?) it was masked by the hollandaise - so acidic that it tasted like an entire lemon tree was used for our serving. 

The fried potatoes came out cold and was half the portion of the two tables next to us. The server was attentive and supplemented us with another plate of potatoes. It was hard to understand how our original plate was allowed to leave the kitchen in the first place...

Overall, it left a lot to be desired. For a ~$20 per person meal, I'd rather wait three hours for Plow.
author: Lisa H.

description:
I dropped in for Cracked & Battered's brunch today; what a wonderful experience!  This new restaurant to Potrero Hill will definitely be a welcomed addition to the community.

I ordered the Chicken and Waffles and was very happy with the delicious (and plentiful) plate that appeared - what a great breakfast to kick off the day.  In the past, I've also had their Chicken Sandwich and their Shakshouka; I hold these two dishes as my favorites, in their respective categories, within the city.

Mo, the owner, and all of his staff were super welcoming - everybody had smiles on their faces and maintained a positive and friendly vibe across the restaurant.  

Will definitely be making this one of my goto spots in Potrero Hill.
author: Travis B.

description: This place is off the hook. Family owned. I had the Fried Chicken and the boys had the smoked Salmon. The hollandaise was definitely homemade. So lemony and creamy. The salmon was fresh and light. The biscuit light and fluffy. The fried chicken had a delicious flavor without the batter being over done. I have to rave about the potatoes because I love well done potatoes. They were perfectly crispy. My only complaint is the chicken only has one egg, but after conversing with the owner/manager it is understood why. They have a small menu, which is my preference also. They do a few things excellently.  We will definitely return.
author: Victoria W.

description: Delicious!!!!!  Tasty, well flavored Indonesia Rice Great welcoming staff, def will we back.
author: Gorma K.

description: Had to drop my son off at an event in the city and wait for him to finish so I decided to find a breakfast place. Yelled for a breakfast place close by. Came up with the Plow which clearly had a long wait list so looked for something else close by. Found Cracked and Battered. Walked right in--order at the counter, pay and find a place to sit--no waiting for someone to take your order or bring your bill. My husband and I split chicken and waffles. Great portion size. It was enough to fill us both up. Plus they gave us some eggs on the house. Chicken was juicy inside and crunchy on the outside. Waffles were delicious. Mimosa was good. Definitely recommend  this as a spot to try out. Why wait in line down the street when you can enjoy chicken and waffles in 10 min.
author: Joleen R.

description:
SKIP THE LINE AT PLOW - Come to this new brunch place serving amazing food with good service and delicious fried chicken. We ordered a lemon ricotta pancake to share and I had the fried chicken Benedict. 

Service- 5 stars
The owner went above and beyond to accommodate us and made sure everything was good. He served us their homemade hummus because we waited a little longer to get our food

Food - 5 stars
The fried chicken Benedict was amazing. Their homemade lemon hollandaise sauce was lighter than most but was just as rich and delicious. Do NOT skip on their fried chicken!

The lemon ricotta pancakes were good to share but not enough for an actual meal. It's an ideal serving for kids. The pancake itself was moist and fluffy on the inside and crispy on the outside. Though there wasn't that much ricotta in the pancake, it was still delicious. 

Drink - 5 stars
They have cold brew and unsweetened matcha green tea on tap. The matcha green tea tastes like a matcha latte, except without the milk and sweetener! The cold brew tastes like nitro-cold brew and is light and creamy   

Overall I would come back and definitely recommend this place! Last but not least, you go up to the register to order and grab utensils, condiments and water for yourself. Mostly self service except for the food!
author: Kevin Z.

description:
My fiancee and I saw the soft opening and wandered in on the promise of chicken and waffles, and ended up getting the fried chicken sandwich and the fried chicken benedict, both of which were delicious.  The fried chicken is perfectly cooked and really juicy, just like is should be.  The batter is a little peppery, which my fiancee loves, but if you're someone like me who likes it less peppery the owner said its all made to order so we can order it without pepper in the future.  The service was great (and fast), and on top of it they sent us some complimentary homemade hummus and pita that was outstanding (the owner said it is a personal recipe that takes three days to make).

The menu is still being rolled out, and when we mentioned we'd like to see more greens on the menu, the owner treated us to a small fattoush salad (currently on the menu) and fried cauliflower (soon to be added to the menu).  Both were really good, and next time we stop by we plan to order them (in addition to fried chicken, of course).
author: Matt B.

description: Just ate here and got the lemon ricotta pancakes of my dreams! I wish they could put the blueberries in the pancakes but they are amazing regardless!!! I will definitely be back. The potatoes were delish as well. Oh and the STAFF is super amazing and easy to talk to. Love it!
author: Erika J.

description:
Yeah, no thanks. Had to wait, then got a table and waited in line again for ordering. Space is tight Everything was just "bleh." The shakshouka was an embarrassment to it's food class. If you want good shakshouka, go to Pera next door. No wait, amazing dish done right. We also got chicken and waffles. Chicken was ok, good. Waffle was ok, but we were given about 2 tablespoons of syrup for the whole thing, then the waiters are so busy it took 10 minutes to track someone down for more. 

Overall: Great concept, they need to work on the flow and make their recipes pop a bit more. Feels like the approach is a bit lazy, like we can do whatever because people will flock for chicken and waffles. Try harder!
author: Erika G.

description:
Great new addition to the hill.

Staff are super nice and friendly and the fried chicken sandwich is a real tasty bite.

Tried the salmon Benedict and asked them to do a small side salad for me (not in the menu) and they happily obliged.

Looking forward to coming back and trying brunch at the weekend.
author: SIMON R.

description:
Love this place. The menu is unique but not too unique where you don't understand anything on the menu. The Nasi Gorang is an Indonesian fried rice...I LOVE IT. My sister loved the Big Country and the fiancé thought the burger was perfectly cooked and the egg was perfectly runny and the fries perfectly seasoned. 

Definitely coming back here again.
author: Gus S.

description:
Stopped in to check their menu out during their soft opening. It's a small menu but they keep adding to it. The staff is very friendly and willing to help and have a conversation with you. A party of 3 and we ordered the Chicken and Waffles, the Fried Chicken Benedict and their Brazilian breakfast. Chicken and Waffles were awesome and so was the benedict. The Brazilian breakfast was perfectly spiced with the chilis.
Looking forward to having more meals there and excited to see their growing menu.
author: Ian R.

description:
Stumbled upon this place with a friend while they were having their soft opening & decided to give them a try! It appeared kind of dark from the outside but the inside was nicely decorated and very cozy. We decided to sit outside since it was a nice day but our table was slanted due to the hill, which was slightly awkward but still doable. 

I ordered the fried chicken and waffles -- I found the chicken a little too peppery for my taste but it was boneless, which I appreciated, and the portion was huge. My friend ordered the Belgian waffle and a side of eggs, and we were also treated to hummus and warm pita on the house, which was excellent. 

It is a little expensive but it's around the price range of most places in the area, so it's not outrageous. The workers were very kind and attentive. I'm definitely looking forward to coming back here and seeing their expanded menu!
author: Annika O.

description:
Really wanted to like this place. 
First time there told I could sit anywhere. Server brought menus to the table but then I was told to go to counter to order and pay (and tip) before even tasting the food. 
Service: meh
Food: meh
Prediction: out of business in 12 months
author: Stewart D.

description: Yummy lemon ricotta pancakes, and good fried chicken. A little on the heavy side so probably won't come every weekend, but great once in a while.
author: Maggie S.

description: Went for breakfast. "Soft opening" so it claimed. Not quite sure what that entailed however we were seated then asked to just order at the bar when ready. Very limited menu and the entire restaurant smelled like urine. Unfortunate.
author: Lindsay K.

description: Been waiting to try this place and I'm honestly disappointed and wish that I didn't even come. I came on a slightly busy Sunday and thought it would benefit us by putting our name on the waitlist via yelp before We even came. We still ended up waiting for at least 45 minutes when there were several open tables inside. When we were finally seated, we had to get back up to order at the counter which is a little disappointing. Now on to the food - I ordered the chicken & waffle which could have been amazing had they not used chicken THIGHS! I mean yuck!! The chicken is seasoned and fried perfectly, but the meat inside is super gummy and I would prefer a breast. The waffle was alright. My partner ordered the burger which he liked but complained of how messy it was. We also ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes which our baby loved! Pretty popular place but I say come and have your own experience. I won't be back
author: Ashley W.

description:
The star of the show was definitely the chicken and waffles my husband ordered - it's a waffle + two large pieces of chicken, so we all got to try some of it. The chicken was absolutely delicious: crispy outside, well-seasoned, and perfect inside. My son had the lemon ricotta pancakes, which were good but a bit heavy - a few more minutes on the griddle would have been good. I had the shakshouka, which was also delicious - perfect eggs, flavorful tomato sauce, and good pita. 

What was really outstanding was the service. Everyone we talked to was helpful & friendly, and whenever we needed anything they seemed to be right there. 

What was really above and beyond was this: my six year old does not like butter, I mean like really not at all. We didn't realize that the pancake would come with a big knob of butter on top, so as soon as I saw it, I lifted it up with my fork to keep it from melting into the hot pancake. Then I realized I had nowhere to put it... just as I was looking for a place to put it, one of the servers saw me looking around and came to the rescue. He was beyond gracious. It's a small thing, but it shows a level of commitment and attention that is not common and that I deeply appreciate.
author: Meghan C.

description: Love that you can order at the counter - makes things a lot quicker when you have a toddler in tow. The batter on the chicken was crispy and quite good, the waffle was flavorful (although I wish it was a little more crispy), and I liked the shashouka as well. Would definitely come again! Since it's still in soft opening mode there was no wait on a Saturday at 9:30.
author: Jen K.

description: New to making a restaurant review.  Very welcoming atmosphere.  Music and smiles walking inside.  The food was very flavorful.  Definitely, would recommend this place.
author: Paul M.

description: This place is so good! Very creative menu with lots of unique takes on classic meals that everyone loves. Definitely try the pita and hummus as well as the fried chicken Benedict. This place is the DEFINITION OF COMFORT FOOD. Indulge
author: Lexi T.

description: No impressed.  Sat down to eat, instead of the waitress taking out order she sent us to the register to order.  The cashier was picking his nose staring off into space when I walked up and didn't say anything.  Received my Midnight burger and it was soaked in grease and fell apart after the first bite.  Wife had the farmers breakfast - scrambled with turkey sausage but instead got an omelette with bacon.  There was three or four hairs my wife found in her food.  Used the rest room which they store their grease trap for the food in there with all of their their mops and extra cleaning supplies - they probably use the same mops in the kitchen.  Would not come back or recommend this place.
author: Leahcim S.

description: Soft opening so they have lots of things to work through. I happen to stumble upon this one Sunday afternoon with some friends. We were seated and sort of waited around for like 5 minutes before they gave us a menu. No one told us that we ordered at the counter until another few minutes. I ordered the $16 Fried Chicken Benedict and was excited until I was given me my order. They ran out of potatoes so said, "we ran out of potatoes so we GAVE you a salad." It would of been nice to be told that they ran out and given options of a replacement. It was definitely not worth the $16. Overall food is OK, but service definitely needs to be worked on.
author: Mayra A.

description:
Went here today for breakfast and got the eggs benedict with fried chicken. It wasn't terrible, but there wasn't much flavor to the chicken or egg. For $16, you actually only get one egg to spread over both biscuits. This was pretty confusing given the cost and that the egg is the most important part of eggs Benedict. They are still in the opening phases though, so hopefully they refine some of these things in the future. I also think the price point is a little high (it's easily $50 for two people for breakfast) given that everything is self-serve here and you order at the counter.

Update: the owner reached out and it sounds like they are working on some of these issues, which is great! Hope the kinks get worked out.
author: Amy B.

description: Food was great!  The fried chicken on a biscuit with eggs Benedict on top served with potatoes was good although we thought the sauce was a little lemony. The Shakouka was awesome (we had to get extra pita as the sauce was so good ) the scramble was good, and the chicken and waffles were bangin'!  I wish it would have been full service.  All in all this is a great place with some unique spins on traditional breakfast food.  Highly reccomend!!!
author: Anthony D.

description:
Loved this place. The staff is very friendly and the food was amazing! I had the chicken sandwich OMG! It was huge and really good. 
I also like that the menu is small and not overwhelming. I will definitely be back.
author: Nancy M.

description: Chicken and waffles were great! Had the chance to go during soft opening when the brunch place I was planning on going to looked rather unappetizing. This was a great place to go instead. Wish they had mimosas - maybe in the future? But the food and coffee were great.
author: Trevor F.

description: I love the place the best quality food and very welcoming service I would recommend for everyone who appreciates amazing food and the prices are great
author: Valeria L.

description: My boyfriend and I just went by this place for their soft opening. The staff was very friendly and attentive and everything was delicious! We tried their two eggs benedicts and both were very good. I had the smoked salmon one and it had a very generous helping of salmon which I appreciated. Their potatoes were also very flavorful - bf compared them to Five Guys' cajun fries. We'll definitely be back!
author: Jesenia G.

description: So excited to have a new spot in Potrero Hill. We stopped in for brunch and split the Shakshouka Eggs and Fried Chicken Sandwich. Both were awesome. We are looking forward to their full menu to come out soon.
author: Ben G.

description: The food here was below average not fresh and special but what was concerning was the poor hygiene.  The staff needs a class on service and cleanliness. Will not return.
author: Ed M.

description: Potatoes were way too salty, could barely eat them. The buckwheat pancake was mushy with dried fruit in it, super sour. The eggs were slimy. The turkey sausage tasted like store bought frozen links. The person next to us complained that the plates did not come out at the same time. When the waitress told the cook, he gave a nasty look. The person on the other side of us said that the food smelled like rubber. There was this strange order at the counter thing, which was awkward. Def not worth the price.
author: Michael R.

description: Great service and really incredible food. The Nasi Goreng and shakshuka were amazing. Will definitely come back!
author: Andres L.

description: Great food and atmosphere. Very friendly staff. Had the fried chicken sandwich w/fries. Delicious! Fried chicken can be tricky but mine was cooked perfectly. Wonderful addition to the neighborhood!
author: Bob H.

description: Really had a outstanding lunch here today.  We went for the first time and couldn't be more pleased with this new addition to the Hill.  The owner was very involved and made us feel welcome as well as talking to us about the food.  We had waffles and fried chicken and both were terrific.  Also had a special dish called shashouka (sp?) that was excellent.  The hummus was also spot on.  We will be back and hope it will be a go to  restaurant in our neighborhood.
author: Kelly W.

description: Food is delicious, hummus was probably the best I've ever had. Never written a yelp review before but I loved this place.
author: Ryan C.

description: Great service, delicious food, perfect brunch spot. Will definitely be a neighborhood favorite!! Get the hummus and nasi goreng! So good!!
author: Courtney S.

description: My friend and I ordered the Soujouk and it was a yummy ethnic twist to regular boring breakfast with great flavors!
author: Meag Z.

description: Came to this place on a whim and was I utterly impressed!! The service was fantastic and the food was excellent! Well worth the price of admission. I had the chicken and waffles and I have to say it was probably one of the best if not the best I've ever had!! Will definitely return.
author: Gabe P.

description: Came in for the soft opening for this brand new small business in my neighborhood. Absolutely loved the food. I don't like chicken, however the chicken here was the best chicken I have had in a very long time. The chicken and waffle is an odd but an extremely complementary dish. My only complaint is that they took more than 30min to bring out our food. There was only one other group in the restaurant. I'm hoping this was just because it is new and still the soft opening. I wish this restaurant the best of luck!
author: Amelia S.
